distributional 0.3.1
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.125228 10.048557
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.080409 1.122188
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.005197953  0.091086387
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] -0.70794949  0.06784658 -0.01185695  0.78209434  0.68476901 -0.43475224
#>  [7]  0.12818136  1.57596531 -0.24045289  0.60470958
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 10.564092  9.168973  9.066714 11.754525 11.736210 11.688654 10.863616
#>  [8] 10.671685 10.306921 10.702638
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2121881 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.004573327 10.059952193
variance(dist)
#>             [,1]        [,2]
#> [1,]  0.89611901 -0.05297356
#> [2,] -0.05297356  0.95285776
skewness(dist)
#> [1] 0.00429905
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>              [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,]  1.05497267  9.935890
#>  [2,] -0.70100657  9.645707
#>  [3,] -0.08807327 11.440889
#>  [4,] -0.76018674 11.410017
#>  [5,]  0.93792595 10.226233
#>  [6,]  0.07322102  9.843428
#>  [7,] -0.07485772  9.617440
#>  [8,] -1.00997031 10.681039
#>  [9,] -0.44866142  9.216227
#> [10,] -1.02206516 10.822217
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2452012 0.0000000
